results:
Based on the search results, I found comprehensive information about Marek Marszał's Polish translation of "Diuna" (Dune) published by Wydawnictwo Iskry in 1985. Here's what the search revealed:

The first Polish edition of "Diuna" (Dune) by Frank Herbert was translated by Marek Marszał, with cover art by Kazimierz Hałajkiewicz, and published by Wydawnictwo Iskry in 1985. Marek Marszał was the first Polish translator of Frank Herbert's Dune in 1985.

Marszał was the translator of the first Polish translation of "Dune" from 1985, and his translation continues to enjoy the greatest recognition and popularity among fans of the series. The book was part of the "Fantastyka Przygoda" series.

Marek Marszał (born December 25, 1944, died August 7, 2020) was a Polish translator of science fiction literature. After more than two decades, Marszał returned to the Dune cycle and translated "Dune Messiah" in 2007 and "Children of Dune" in 2008 (together with Andrzej Jankowski).

The detailed publication information from the search shows that the 1985 first Polish edition included graphic design by Kazimierz Hałajkiewicz and was edited by Żona Uhrynowska, with ISBN 83-207-0772-2.
